lenders.name: Agents for Home Buyers
lenders.occupation: Real Estate Agents Representing Home Buyers
lenders.loan_because:
We make our living helping people buy homes, people who rely on mortgage loans to improve their lives.  And like most small businesses, we've relied on loans both to start our business and to keep it growing.  So we know from personal experience that affordable and accessible loans can help transform lives and build communities.  We're excited that the people at Kiva have created a system that allows us to "pay it forward" in such a concrete and rewarding way.  We are committing 10% of our gross company income to funding Kiva loans.  If we can swing it financially, our goal is to leave at least half of these funds in the Kiva system permanently for relending.
Total Kiva Loans......................................$161,550.00

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.loan_because: As a college student, I have limited time and financial resources. However, what I have to deal with is nothing compared to the challenges many in the world face on a daily basis - I definitely can’t complain. The money I lend to Kiva.org is money that I’ve worked hard to earn during the summer, but I know that it is a sacrifice worth making. In a college Ethics class, the most unforgettable lesson I learned was the idea that allowing someone to suffer, when you have the power to help, is the moral equivalent of intentionally inflicting pain upon them. Based on this, I came to the conclusion that I have the moral responsibility to make a difference. Kiva.org offers me an excellent opportunity to put into practice my moral obligation. Furthermore, I sponsor a six-year-old Vietnamese boy named Ky, as well as joined a local chapter “Big Brothers/Big Sisters”, where I volunteer several hours every two weeks trying to make the life of my “Little Brother” Chris a better one.
